summary: The National Institutes of Health plays a key role in biomedical research to reduce illness and lengthen life. It has its own scientific staff but more than 80% of its budget goes to researchers working in universities and other institutions. NIH funding can be critical to careers and competition is intense. Grants tend to be awarded to experienced researchers. Researchers with less experience and from...
title: NIH Research: Action Needed to Ensure Workforce Diversity Strategic Goals Are Achieved
